l1_part2_questions.question:
Describe a service you received that was very good. You should say:
What the service was
When you received it
Who provided the service
And explain why you thought it was good.
l1_part2_questions.model_answer:
I'd like to describe a recent trip to a bank where the service was incredibly Efficient [高效的]. I was initially Reluctant [不情愿的] and Hesitant [犹豫的] to go because banks are usually slow. The clerk gave me Constructive [建设性的] advice that was very Sensible [明智的] for my situation. Since she shared A word of wisdom [至理名言] about saving money, I will definitely Take it to heart [铭记在心]. Her help was Indispensable [不可或缺的] for my future financial plans. I felt that we were In the same boat [处境相同], working together to solve my problem. I was truly Grateful [感激的] for her kindness and patience throughout the process.

Brainstorming Ideas:
- Service: Bank / Shop
- Who: Clerk / Manager
- Good: Fast / Clear
- Why: Saved money

l1_part2_questions.question:
Describe a time you received bad service. You should say:
What the service was
When it happened
What the problem was
And explain how you felt about it.
l1_part2_questions.model_answer:
I'm going to talk about calling tech support, which was not Efficient [高效的] at all. I was Reluctant [不情愿的] to call, knowing it would be hard to get through. Although I was Hesitant [犹豫的] to complain at first, the staff was not Sensible [明智的]. They gave no Constructive [建设性的] help, and we were all stuck In the same boat [处境相同] waiting forever. Their service should be Indispensable [不可或缺的], but it was useless. I did not Take it to heart [铭记在心] when they finally apologized. I was not Grateful [感激的] for the A word of wisdom [至理名言] they tried to offer too late. It was a terrible waste of my day.

Brainstorming Ideas:
- Service: Phone / Internet
- Problem: Slow / Rude
- Felt: Angry / Sad
- Result: Switched company

l1_part2_questions.question:
Describe a company that provides good service. You should say:
What the company does
How you know about it
What makes their service good
And explain why you would recommend them.
l1_part2_questions.model_answer:
I wish to describe an online bookstore that is Indispensable [不可或缺的] for students like me. Their delivery is always Efficient [高效的] and faster than anyone else. Because they offer Constructive [建设性的] reviews, I am never Reluctant [不情愿的] or Hesitant [犹豫的] to buy from them. Their Sensible [明智的] prices make me feel very Grateful [感激的]. They often share A word of wisdom [至理名言] in their weekly newsletter, which I always Take it to heart [铭记在心]. Many customers are In the same boat [处境相同], looking for good books, and this company helps them perfectly every time. I recommend [推荐] them highly.

Brainstorming Ideas:
- Company: Amazon / eBay
- Good: Fast / Cheap
- Rec: Easy / Safe
- Why: Trust

l2_part3_questions.question: What qualities make a good service provider?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] From my perspective [观点/视角], the most important quality is offering Wisdom [智慧] and honesty. [Reason] Customers need expert advice to trust that their problems will be solved correctly. [Example] Unless there is good Interaction [互动], clients will feel lost and confused, much like The blind leading the blind [问道于盲]. Also, respecting client Privacy [隐私] is key to building a long-term relationship. Trust is everything in business.
idea_suggestions: Opinion: Honest. Reason: Trust. Example: Telling the truth about costs.

l2_part3_questions.question: Why do some companies have poor service?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] It seems to me that they lack proper training and Intervention [干预] from management. [Reason] Employees often face a Dilemma [进退两难的困境] between working fast and working well. [Example] Since they don't receive enough Counseling [咨询/辅导] on how to handle complaints, they fail to satisfy customers. They often Learn the hard way [通过吃亏学到教训] when their customers leave for competitors. It is a management failure.
idea_suggestions: Opinion: Low pay. Reason: Unhappy staff. Example: Rude waiters.

l2_part3_questions.question: How should customers react to bad service?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] I believe they should be calm and Objective [客观的]. [Reason] Getting angry rarely solves the issue effectively and only makes things worse. [Example] Even though it is frustrating, one shouldn't Sit on the fence [保持中立/观望]; complain politely to get a resolution. Counseling [咨询] the manager is better than shouting at the staff. Being polite gets better results.
idea_suggestions: Opinion: Calmly. Reason: Better result. Example: Asking for a refund.

l2_part3_questions.question: Is the customer always right?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] Unfortunately, I don't think so. Customers can often be wrong or unreasonable. [Reason] Sometimes their demands invade staff Privacy [隐私] or break company rules. [Example] While staff should provide Wisdom [智慧], they must sometimes stage an Intervention [干预] to stop rude behavior. A balance of respect is needed for good service. Staff deserve respect too.

l2_part3_questions.question: How has technology changed customer service?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] Unquestionably, it has changed Interaction [互动] drastically for everyone. [Reason] We now use bots and AI instead of humans for initial Counseling [咨询]. [Example] Provided that the AI is Objective [客观的], it works well, but complex issues cause a Dilemma [进退两难的困境]. Sometimes you just need a real person to understand the problem. Technology cannot replace empathy.

l2_part3_questions.question: What is the difference between service in small shops and big companies?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] I think the main difference is the level of personal Interaction [互动]. [Reason] Small shops offer personal Wisdom [智慧] and care that big chains lack. [Example] Whereas big companies might treat you like a number, small shops don't Sit on the fence [保持中立]; they truly care. Big companies often invade Privacy [隐私] for data, while small shops respect you as a person.
idea_suggestions: Opinion: Friendly. Reason: Know you. Example: Local baker chats.
